description: From Middle English stepchild, stepchyld, from Old English stēopċild (“stepchild”), equivalent to step- +‎ child. Compare Dutch stiefkind (“stepchild”), German Stiefkind (“stepchild”), Swedish styvbarn (“stepchild”).

entries.meaning: The child of one's spouse but not one's own.
(obsolete) A bereaved child; one who has lost father or mother.
